definitions.definition: Matter which may be shaped or manipulated, particularly in making something.
definitions.example: Asphalt, composed of oil and sand, is a widely used material for roads.

definitions.definition: Text written for a specific purpose.
definitions.example: We were a warm-up act at the time; we didn't have enough original material to headline.

definitions.definition: A sample or specimens for study.
Cloth to be made into a garment. Fabric.
definitions.example: You'll need about a yard of material to make this.

definitions.definition: The people collectively who are qualified for a certain position or activity.
definitions.example: He is not the only one. I believe we have lots of presidential material in various public offices.

definitions.definition: Related data of various kinds, especially if collected as the basis for a document or book.
The substance that something is made or composed of.
All of a player's pieces and pawns on the chessboard.
To form from matter; to materialize.
